title: Set a placeholder variable
text: Since $${\left(x^2\right)}^2=x^4$$, we can let $$u=x^2$$. Substitute $$x^2$$ for u throughout the equation.

title: Factor
text: Now, factor the equation so that it is in the form (au~b)(cu~d).

title: Use the Zero Product Property
text: Solve for the variable u by setting each of the two terms equal to zero. Then, once you have found a value for u, plug in $$x^2$$ for u.

title: Solve
text: Solve for x by taking the square root of both sides.

title: Check
text: Check all 4 x values(including both positive and negative values) you just solved for by plugging them back into the original equation. If the value is correct, the equation will be equal on both sides after solving.
